alert.note: Alert for Halifax (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 8:03PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Halifax County through 900 PM EDT... At 801 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near 7 miles southeast of Halifax. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Locally heavy rainfall of up to 1.5 inches in 45 minutes and gusty winds to near 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Urban and small stream flooding is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Halifax, Enfield and Tillery. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
